intro: Parageum calthifolium var. nipponicum, commonly known as the Japanese white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
